intro: Alonsoa compacta, commonly known as the compact alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
